data.title: Newhaven Port & Properties Limited
data.meta_description: Newhaven Port & Properties Limited | 154 followers on LinkedIn. Newhaven Port and Properties is the Competent Harbour Authority for Newhaven Port.
data.text:
üì£ Looking for office space? Newhaven Ferry Terminal offices reopen for business after ¬£1.25m revamp... The 1970s offices on the first floor of Newhaven Ferry Terminal building have now been brought back into use following an extensive revamp which includes solar panels and sustainable building materials. Newhaven Port & Properties Limited port manager captain Dave Collins-Williams said the new offices would help the port to attract forward thinking tenants to invest in the area and to build on the port‚Äôs plans for the future. Corinne Day, programme director at Newhaven Enterprise Zone said: ‚ÄúThe marine sector is a key part of Newhaven‚Äôs economy. As our town continues to grow and develop, we‚Äôre getting increasing demand from businesses for commercial space so it‚Äôs fantastic news that the port has delivered these new offices for businesses to move into. ‚ÄúNewhaven Enterprise Zone is very proud to work in partnership with the port as a key driver of our town‚Äôs prosperity and appeal.‚Äù Three of the offices at the site in Railway Approach are available now and one has already been let to a logistics company. The newly refurbished offices are available at ¬£240 per sqm on a minimum three-year lease term with break options. This includes all bills, except business rates, as well as secure access, a communal kitchen and rest rooms. There is also a conference room to hire at an hourly rate. The three offices available range from 46 sqm to 69 sqm in size. The offices boast easy access to Newhaven Town Station, the bus interchange and taxi rank. They are also walking distance from town centre and town car parks. For more information, please contact Captain Dave or Mark Beaver via admin@newhavenport.com or 01273 616070. More information and floor plans here: https://lnkd.in/dAKkCkmU #commercialproperty #maritime #officespace Kevin Holmes Michelle Connors Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr

We are pleased to announce that Newhaven Port & Properties Limited are now on board as co-sponsors of our Community Engagement activities during this years main exhibition which will be at the Marine Workshops in October. "Newhaven Port & Properties Ltd are happy to be the Community Engagement Co-Sponsors, extending our support to the Sussex Contemporary Exhibition. Newhaven Port dates back nearly 400 years, providing an important trade and passenger link between England and France. As the Port Authority, we are committed to fostering local initiatives that resonate with the community. By championing events like the Sussex Contemporary Exhibition, we aim to cultivate a vibrant cultural landscape that celebrates diversity, creativity, and inclusivity within the community we serve." Captain Dave Collins-Williams, Port Manager #sussexart #sussexartists #sussexcontemporary #newhaven #communitysupport

Brilliant to host State21.Ltd in Newhaven to deliver training in Managing Major Incidents and Defensible Decision Making to Newhaven Port and Properties staff. Stephen Tindale Newhaven Port Harbour Master said ‚ÄôVery useful training allowing us to look closely at our emergency response in the event of an incident, delivered by the very knowledgeable Gavin and Richard. We look forward to working further with State 21 in May‚Äô Richard Rowland CMgr FCMI State 21 Port and Maritime Director said ‚ÄòIt was a pleasure to work with the Port of Newhaven and staff who are clearly so dedicated to safety and security.‚Äô
